newsitem.title: USA: American Gaming FY 96 net loss narrows.
newsitem.headline: American Gaming FY 96 net loss narrows.

text.p: (All data above 000s except per share numbers)

NOTE: American Gaming & Entertainment Ltd said its net loss for 1996 included a gain of approximately $948,000 on the sale of the company's keno assets in March 1996, the reversal of approximately $3,329,000 of unutilized lease costs, the writeoff of approximately $991,000 due to the company from its major stockholder and creditor relating to costs and expenses paid by the company in connection with the Harolds Club in Reno, Nevada, the writedown of certain impaired assets totaling approximately $4,438,000, the writeoff of approximately $3,504,000 of deferred financing and commitment fees due to the company's major stockholder and creditor, and an accrual of $2,250,000 as management's estimate of additional settlement liabilities related to the company's two Mississippi subsidiaries currently in bankruptcy.

Net loss for 1995 included a gain of approximately $301,000 from the final installment payment received from the sale of substantially all of the company's bingo business assets, the recognition of unutilized lease costs of approximately $4,463,000, approximately $8,168,000 in equity losses related to the operations of the company's two Mississippi subsidiaries currently in bankruptcy (for which no losses were recorded in fiscal 1996), and writedowns of certain impaired assets totaling approximately $3,671,000.
